intro: Tilingia jeholensis, commonly known as the Jehol tilingia, is a rare flowering plant native to northern China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features include hairy stems and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
